org.svvrl.goal.core.util

Class PowerSet<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.util.PowerSet<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of elements in the set

    public class PowerSet<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides methods for constructing a power set of a set.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PowerSet(java.util.Set<T> c)
      Constructs a power set of a collection of elements.
      PowerSet(java.util.Set<T> c, boolean rev)
      Constructs a power set of a collection of elements.
      PowerSet(java.util.Set<T> c, int m)
      Constructs a power set of a collection of elements but removes subsets of size greater than a specified number.
      PowerSet(java.util.Set<T> c, int m, boolean rev)
      Constructs a power set of a collection of elements but removes subsets of size greater than a specified number.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean hasNext()
      Returns true if there are elements in the power set not generated yet.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PowerSet

        public PowerSet(java.util.Set<T> c)
        Constructs a power set of a collection of elements.
        Parameters:
        c - a collection of elements

      • PowerSet

        public PowerSet(java.util.Set<T> c,
                int m)
        Constructs a power set of a collection of elements but removes subsets of size greater than a specified number.
        Parameters:
        c - a collection of elements
        m - the maximum size of a subset

      • PowerSet

        public PowerSet(java.util.Set<T> c,
                boolean rev)
        Constructs a power set of a collection of elements. The order of the generated power set is specified by rev. If rev is false, the subsets will be generated from the empty set to the whole input set. If rev is true, the subsets will be generated from the whole input set to the empty set.
        Parameters:
        c - a collection of elements
        rev - indicating if the power set is generated in the reverse order

      • PowerSet

        public PowerSet(java.util.Set<T> c,
                int m,
                boolean rev)
        Constructs a power set of a collection of elements but removes subsets of size greater than a specified number. The order of the generated power set is specified by rev. If rev is false, the subsets will be generated from the empty set to the whole input set. If rev is true, the subsets will be generated from the whole input set to the empty set.
        Parameters:
        c - a collection of elements
        m - the maximum size of a subset
        rev - indicating if the power set is generated in the reverse order
